result.execSummary:
The defendant Omareyon S Renfro was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Omareyon S Renfro is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Omareyon S Renfro was found guilty of Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence. STRAIGHT TIME.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges during the period of probation. Any remaining balance at the end of a probation will be  
due immediately or an entry of a civil judgment.
Obtain and maintain employment, or actively looking for employment.
Court will consider motion for expungement if defendant pays the costs successfully completes the sentence and has no further violations of the law raising to the level of probable cause.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

timeConds.notes: As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days (STRAIGHT TIME) in the House of Correction.  This time is to be used at the agent's discretion.
Successfully complete (25) hours of community service.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Omareyon S Renfro

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 2:

Defendant sentenced to serve 100 days (STRAIGHT TIME) in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for  3 (three) days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 12 months:


CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
     *   As a condition of probation, the Court ordered
          the defendant to serve 30 days (STRAIGHT TIME)
          in the House of Correction.  This time is to be used
          at the agent's discretion.
     *   Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
          and successfully complete recommended treatment
          including random urine screens.
     *   No illegal drugs.
     *   No firearms; weapons.
     *   Successfully complete (25) hours of community
          service.
     *   Obtain and maintain employment, or actively 
          looking for employment.
     *   Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
          treatment deemed appropriate.
     *   Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges during the 
          period of probation.
          Any remaining balance at the end of a probation will be  
          due immediately or an entry of a civil judgment.
.
Court will consider motion for expungement if defendant pays the costs successfully completes the sentence and has no further violations of the law raising to the level of probable cause.
.
Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Rights and Pretrial Incarceration Credit; received and filed.

Defendant Omareyon S Renfro in court with attorney Hazel Jean Washington. Student Intern Nathaniel Stevenson under the student practice rule supervised by Assistant District Attorney Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

AS TO COUNT 1:

On motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed.

AS TO COUNT 2:

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Defendant Omareyon S Renfro in court with attorney Hazel Jean Washington.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests case be set for plea and sentencing. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. Case adjourned to Branch 37.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Omareyon S Renfro in court with attorney Hazel Jean Washington.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for pre-trial conference. 

Defense counsel has received discovery and offer. Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 37. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.

  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Omareyon S Renfro in court.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.   Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 9/10/15 @ 1:30 pm
